newsitem.title: USA: Medical Alliance expects break-even Q1 EPS.
newsitem.headline: Medical Alliance expects break-even Q1 EPS.

text.p: Medical Alliance Inc said Friday it expects to break-even earnings per share in the first quarter, on revenues of $5.0 million.
A year earlier the company earned $0.03 a share on net revenues of $3.96 million, it said.
Medical Alliance said its forecast was based on a review of preliminary results.

Medical Alliance said its previously announced exclusive provider agreement with Imagyn Medical Inc did not occur as soon as anticipated. As a result, Medical Alliance was unable to realize "significant" revenues from the agreement in the first quarter, it said.
At the same time, expenses for salaries and benefits rose in implementing another provider agreement with Thermolase Corp, it said.
Medical Alliance provides services to create temporary surgical cites in doctors' offices in 46 states and Canada.
